text:
A PAC may have an initial collar given as 100 – 300 PSA. This means the PAC will
make its scheduled payments to investors unless actual prepayment experience is outside
these bounds (i.e., above 300 PSA or below 100 PSA). If the prepayment rate is outside
of these bounds so payments to a PAC tranche are either sooner or later than promised,
the PAC tranche is referred to as a broken PAC.
